comments:
When using the Update operation for CVS, getting a stacktrace (see below, a part
of my log file) ... The pb seems to be on a date format.

The version used is the 20020612 release.

	static public Date entryLineToDate(String text) throws ParseException {
Here ==>	if (text.charAt(ENTRYLINE_TENS_DAY_OFFSET) == ' ') {
			StringBuffer buf = new StringBuffer(text);
			buf.setCharAt(ENTRYLINE_TENS_DAY_OFFSET, '0');
			text = buf.toString();
		}
		return entryLineFormat.parse(text);
	}

The problem is that CVSNT is sending us something in the entry line that we 
didn't expect. Although our parsing should be more robust, since CVSNT is not 
officially supported, we will not address this problem until after 2.0. In the 
meantime, you may want to try CVSNT 1.11.1.1.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 19791 ***
